settings.title: The Gospel Presents
settings.content: The Gospel presents the first chapter of The Fanatics: Chessboxing with GZA of Wu-Tang Clan

settings.title: Chessboxing with GZA of Wu-Tang Clan
settings.content:
We are kicking off our new event series, The Fanatics, with Wu-Tang Clan’s 'spiritual head' GZA who is co-hosting a speed chess competition with us on Monday 15 May in Melbourne's Inner North. 

This event is a celebration of The Gospel's commitment to bringing people together in appreciation of culture, music and the community. 

It is well-known that GZA is a shark on the chess board and we bring Melbourne's chess community the opportunity to go head-to-head with him. Music fanatics alike can also enjoy as a specator of the chess competition or for an exclusive GZA Meet & Greet. 

African Australian hip-hop artist N’fa will be your guide on the night, alongside vinyl DJ sets of soul, disco, funk and hip-hop tunes from DJ Mr Lob and Deejay Mathmatics.

settings.title: Vinyl After Party
settings.content:
We will also be partnering with Paradise Alley in Collingwood for an after party, bringing a selection of vinyl DJs to play throughout the night.

From 2pm-12am, you'll find The Gospel drink specials alongside a curated schedule of vinyl DJ sets by Mr Lob, who will close the night with the last set from 10pm-12am.

Event details:
Record Store Day Vinyl After Party
Paradise Alley, Collingwood
22 April 2pm-12am

settings.title: On the Journal: GZA THE GENIUS
settings.content:
As part of Record Store Day, we had a chat with Lachlan Stuckey of Surprise Chef to uncover how his passion for collecting vinyl has influenced his music career.

"Scott Towers from Fat Freddy’s Drop recommended a record store in this old, decrepit apartment building in Porto. We spent ages trying to find it. We went along all these hallways, getting lost. We finally saw this open door and a wall of records was inside. There was just this dude chain smoking cigars in this tiny little office that had records stacked up everywhere with no categorisation whatsoever. [...] it’s fun finding a place like that which is a total nightmare. It just makes it more of an adventure.”
